text: Grevillea decora is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to an area in the Great Dividing Range of Queensland. The upright shrub typically grows to a height of . It has leathery narrowly egg-shaped or oval leaves that are a dull greyish-green color long and wide. Inflorescence are a dull, bronze-red colour that appear in dense, terminal, one-sided racemes and are in length, the plant flowers between April and October. ==See also== * List of Grevillea species ==References== decora Category:Proteales of Australia Category:Flora of Queensland
title: Grevillea decora
